# Github Actions Runner Group Association Submodule

This module is used to associate repositories with GitHub Actions runner groups and manage their configuration.

## Features

- Associate repositories with existing runner groups
- Manage workflow restrictions for runner groups
- Control public repository access for runner groups

## Usage

```terraform
module "avm_res_githubrepository_actions_runner_group" {
  source  = "Azure/avm-res-githubrepository/github//modules/actions_runner_group"
  version = "x.y.z"

  name       = "production-runners"
  repository = { id = github_repository.this.repo_id }
  # Optional: configure workflow restrictions
  restricted_to_workflows = true
  selected_workflows      = ["main.yml", ".github/workflows/deploy.yml"]
  # Optional: control public repository access
  allows_public_repositories = false
  # Optional: existing repository IDs in this runner group
  existing_repository_ids = [123456, 789012]
}
```

## Notes

- This module manages existing runner groups only; enterprise-level runner group creation is handled separately
- The runner group must already exist and have `visibility = "selected"` when associating repositories
- Workflow paths must be relative to the repository root

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD033 -->
## Requirements

The following requirements are needed by this module:

- <a name="requirement_terraform"></a> [terraform](#requirement\_terraform) (>= 1.9, < 2.0)

- <a name="requirement_github"></a> [github](#requirement\_github) (~> 6.7)

## Resources

The following resources are used by this module:

- [github_actions_runner_group.this](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/integrations/github/latest/docs/resources/actions_runner_group) (resource)

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD013 -->
## Required Inputs

The following input variables are required:

### <a name="input_name"></a> [name](#input\_name)

Description: The name of the runner group.

Type: `string`

### <a name="input_repository"></a> [repository](#input\_repository)

Description: The repository object containing the numeric repository ID.

Type:

```hcl
object({
    id = number
  })
```

## Optional Inputs

The following input variables are optional (have default values):

### <a name="input_allows_public_repositories"></a> [allows\_public\_repositories](#input\_allows\_public\_repositories)

Description: Whether public repositories can use runners in this group.

Type: `bool`

Default: `false`

### <a name="input_existing_repository_ids"></a> [existing\_repository\_ids](#input\_existing\_repository\_ids)

Description: List of existing repository IDs already associated with this runner group. This ensures we don't remove them when adding the new repository.

Type: `list(number)`

Default: `[]`

### <a name="input_restricted_to_workflows"></a> [restricted\_to\_workflows](#input\_restricted\_to\_workflows)

Description: Whether this runner group can only be used for specific workflows.

Type: `bool`

Default: `false`

### <a name="input_selected_workflows"></a> [selected\_workflows](#input\_selected\_workflows)

Description: List of workflows that can use this runner group. Only applies when restricted\_to\_workflows is true.

Type: `list(string)`

Default: `[]`

### <a name="input_visibility"></a> [visibility](#input\_visibility)

Description: Visibility of the runner group. Must be 'selected' when associating with repositories.

Type: `string`

Default: `"selected"`

## Outputs

No outputs.

## Modules

No modules.
